title: A typology of quantum algorithms
authors: Pablo Arnault, Pablo Arrighi, Steven Herbert, Evi Kasnetsi, Tianyi Li
abstract:
We draw the current landscape of quantum algorithms, by classifying about 130
quantum algorithms, according to the fundamental mathematical problems they
solve, their real-world applications, the main subroutines they employ, and
several other relevant criteria. The primary objectives include revealing
trends of algorithms, identifying promising fields for implementations in the
NISQ era, and identifying the key algorithmic primitives that power quantum
advantage.
